verse.roman:
tāvad vrajaukasas tatra
nanda-gopādayo 'grataḥ
puropavanam āsādya
pratīkṣanto 'vatasthire

synonyms: tāvat—by then; vraja-okasaḥ—the inhabitants of Vraja; tatra—there; agrataḥ—before; pura—of the city; upavanam—a garden; āsādya—coming upon; pratīkṣantaḥ—waiting; avatasthire—they stayed there.
translation: Nanda Mahārāja and the other residents of Vṛndāvana, having reached Mathurā ahead of the chariot, had stopped at a garden on the outskirts of the city to wait for Kṛṣṇa and Balarāma.

purport.text: Nanda and the others reached Mathurā first because the chariot carrying Kṛṣṇa and Balarāma was delayed by Akrūra's bathing.
